results.title: Holiday
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Everett Riskin and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from Philip Barry’s play and a remake of a film made in 1930, George Cukor’s “Holiday” is a wonderful comedy which subtly examines the lives of an unhappy wealth family and a carefree young man who enters their plush world. When Johnny Case (Cary Grant) returns from a skiing holiday to visit his fiance Julie Seton (Doris Nolan) he is shocked to discover she is very very rich. Soon Julie’s father is mapping out their lives, but Julie’s non-conformist sister Linda (Katherine Hepburn) and alcholic brother Ned (Lew Ayres) think that Johnny’s fresh enthusiasm for life could be the antidote for their father’s tiranic rule. Hepburn and Grant give fantastic performances and Cukor’s direction ensures that this is a sparkling romantic comedy.

results.title: Farinelli: il castrato
results.creator_credit: Gerard Corbiau, Vera Belmont, Sony Pictures Classics, Studio Canal + and Stephan Films
results.brief_description: Geriard Corbiau’s “Farinelli” is a lavish drama which tells the story of Carlo Broschi or Farinelli, a castrato who was a European celebrity during the 18th century. Carlo (Stafano Dionisi) is inseparable from his brother Riccardo (Enrio Lo Verso), a mediocre composer whose career depends solely on his brother’s enormous fame. Together the Broschi brothers conquer the courts of Europe, until they are embroilled in an artistic battle with Handel(Jeroen Crabbe) in England. Farinelli’s voice was created by digitally combining the voices of counter tenor Derek Lee Ragin and soprano Ewa Mallas-Godlewska. Voted Best Foreign Language Film at 1995 Golden Globe Awards. Mostly in French with english subtitles.

results.title: Mamma Roma
results.creator_credit: Pier Pasolini, Alfredo Bini, Cineriz and Arco Film (Italy)
results.brief_description: Mamma Roma (Anna Magnani in a truly magnificent performance) is a prostitute hoping to go straight. At the beginning of the film she sees off her pimp, gets herself a market stall, and fetches her teenage son home from the country. But her idyll does not last. The pimp keeps coming back, trying to force her back on the game, her son is unable to hold down a job and when he discovers his mother’s past he drifts into petty crime with tragic results. While very moving and at times disturbing, Pasolini’s story is imbued with a feeling that the world can be someway other than it is and that the deep splits in human nature produced by a failed civilisation can somehow be transcended. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Tuck everlasting
results.creator_credit: Frederick King Keller, Howard Kling and Vestron Video International
results.brief_description: Whynnie Foster, a shy 10 year old living with her grandmother, dreams of being free. She is drawn to the family owned forest to the tune of what her grandmother calls fairy music, created by the elves who live there. Whynnie discovers the magic spring or fountain of youth that has immortilsed the Tuck family who live in the forest and befriend her. They must tell her the secret of the water to ensure she will keep their secret. Throughout the saga a myserious stranger follows Whynnie and attempts to extort her family into selling their land in exchange for Whynnie when she is ‘kidnapped’ by the Tucks. The experience forces Whynnie to examine whether she wants to drink from the magic water and live forever. Based on the novel of the same name by Natalie Babbitt, this video stars Fred A Keller, James McGuire and Paul Flessa. A thought provoking video for older children.

results.title: Horror express
results.creator_credit: Eugenio Martin, Bernard Gordon and JEF Films
results.brief_description: This hair-raiser is a classic Christopher Lee - Peter Cushing chiller guaranteed to give you goosebumps. It is a real blast of science fiction horror which has as its setting the Trans-Siberian Express. Set in 1906, Lee (an explorer) is returning from China with a mysterious crate containing what he believes are the remains of an apelike creature. This missing link is inhabited by an alien force which can assimilate all the knowledge from people simply by staring at them. The process boils their brains, kills the victims instantly, and makes their eyes bleed and turn white. Late the life force takes over the hapless passengers who appear normal, but are actually zombies possessed by the monsters personality. Lee and Cushing team up to defeat the creature. They saw the tops off the victims heads for brain inspections, only to be horrified by their inexplicable discoveries. The dead passengers, now an army of zombies, march through the train toward the petrified survivors.

results.title: How to make an American quilt
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Midge Sanford, Sarah Pillsbury and Amblin Entertainment
results.brief_description: Winona Ryder shines in this deeply moving and touchingly funny story of a Berkeley graduate student Finn (Ryder) who spends the summer at the home of her sparring Grandmother (Anne Bancroft) and great aunt (Ellyn Burstyn). Their house is a quiet haven where she intends to finish her latest thesis and think over a marriage proposal. This beautifully filmed tale brings unbridled passion, true love, betrayal, joy and heartbreak vividly to life in a captivating cinematic tapestry that celebrates finding your way and following your heart. Based on the novel by Whitney Otto.

results.title: The Last of the Mohicans
results.creator_credit: Michael Mann, Hunt Lowry and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: Set in the American colonies during the brutal Anglo-French war of 1757, this fierce romantic adventure chronicles the story of Hawkeye (Daniel Day-Lewis), a whiteman raised by Mohicans, wo becomes entangled in a raging battle between the two rival nations. Exhilarating and exciting, this is adventure on a grand scale, with heart-stopping action, sizzling romance (between Day-Lewis and Madeleine Stowe) and spectacular battle scenes. An epic tale of love and loyalty, this is great entertainment and should not be missed.

results.title: The Long kiss goodnight (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Renny Harlin, Shane Black, Stephanie Austin, Steve Tisch and Forge
results.brief_description: Samantha Cain (Geena Davis) is a school teacher who for the past 8 years has suffered amnesia. Haunted by bizarre flashbacks, she hires private detective Mitch (Samuel L. Jackson), to discover her true identity. They discover that Samantha is actually a lethal government assassin, presumed dead and that’s the way the authorities would like to keep it. Samantha is now hunted by her past and a string of government agents who have placed a contract on her life and kidnapped her daughter.

results.title: Through a glass darkly
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: Bergman’s “Through a glass darkly” centres on the lives of four characters. Karen (Harriet Andersson) suffers from schizophrenia and has just returned from hospital. She lives on a remote island in the Baltic with her husband Martin (Max Von Sydow) and brother Minus (Lars Passgard). David (Gunnar Bjornstrand), their father, is a novelist who returns from Switzerland to visit them. Gradually the severity of Karen’s illness becomes apparent to them all. Despite it’s dark subject matter “Through a glass darkly” is mesmerising to watch thanks to the outstanding performances by the four actors as well Sven Nykvist’s beautiful cinematography. Winner of 1961 Academy Award for Best Foreign Film. In Swedish with english subtitles.

results.title: Wild strawberries
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Allan Ekelund and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: Wild Strawberries is justifiably considered a classic Ingmar Bergman film. Isak Borg (Victor Sjostrom) is 78 and about to be honoured by the University of Lund for his services to medicine. He decides to drive to Lund with his daughter-in-law Marianne (Ingrid Thulin). The film follows the events of the day as he remembers scenes from the past, has bouts of troubling dreams, and meets up with a group of young travellers. Victor Sjostrom is marvelous as the rigid professor who is touched by the warmth of the people who he encounters on this pivotal day. This edition comes with Ingmar Bergman’s screenplay, which gives a fascinating insight into Bergman’s narrative skills, and includes a run-down of the cutting continuity for those interested in the techniques of film-making. In Swedish with English subtitles.
